messages.messageBody:
>
> And by the way, I enjoyed your recent HEM article about the 'head
thru your
> interlocked arms' thingy. I can do it too! I figured most people
could do
> it, til I asked some hsing moms one day and I was the only one who
could. I
> do have long arms though. It was fun!

Well, the rest of them will just have to go to SSRE ("Special Skill
Remedial Education".) There are summer schools being required all
over the country, but they can't do it by September 1, we'll have to
leave the rest of the moms back.

david
www.skylarksings.com

messages.subject: re: spelling/David
messages.msgSnippet: ... thought you might enjoy -- here s the link (with apologies for the pun):
messages.messageBody:
>>I've got an article (which appeared in The Link) on "Unspelling" --
thought you might enjoy -- here's the link (with apologies for the
pun):
<A HREF="http://www.homeschoolnewslink.com/vol6iss5_Unspelling.html>>">http://www.homeschoolnewslink.com/vol6iss5_Unspelling.html</A>
>>

Thank you, David. Interesting article. I'll give the idea a try.

And by the way, I enjoyed your recent HEM article about the 'head thru your
interlocked arms' thingy. I can do it too! I figured most people could do
it, til I asked some hsing moms one day and I was the only one who could. I
do have long arms though. It was fun!

~Ellen

"It is, in fact, nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of
instruction have not yet entirely strangled the holy curiousity of inquiry;
for this delicate little plant, aside from stimulation, stands mainly in need
of freedom."
-- Albert Einstein
